Class FragmentLibrary

  • java.lang.Object
    • FragmentLibrary
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Singleton

    public final class FragmentLibrary
extends java.lang.Object
implements Singleton
    Holds and organizes all fragments. All the pieces in a Catalyst are called Fragments, and this Singleton reads all of those from the input directory. The entries are stored in a map called DATABASE, and are sorted by fragment type. Explanation courtesy of Prof. Kwan.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static DATABASE
      Fragment collection, sorted by type.

    • Method Detail

      • getDatabase

        public static java.lang.String getDatabase()
        Should be used to list items in the DATABASE. Using DATABASE.toString generates an excessively verbose output.

      • createCatalysts

        public static java.util.List<Catalyst> createCatalysts(java.util.List<FragmentType> template,
                                       boolean cyclize)
        Returns a List of cyclized Catalysts from the DATABASE. This requires a template of how to construct the catalyst, given as a List of FragmentTypes. These will have been cyclized, but not yet minimized. This method constructs from LEFT TO RIGHT. WARNING: DO NOT PUT STEREOCENTERS AT THE ENDS OF THE LINEAR MOLECULE WHEN DESIGNING TEMPLATE!!!
        Parameters:
        template -
        cyclize - whether to cyclize or not
        Returns:
        the list of Catalysts

      • createCatalysts

        public static java.util.List<Catalyst> createCatalysts(java.util.List<FragmentType> template)
        Alias method.

      • createC2Catalysts

        public static java.util.List<Catalyst> createC2Catalysts(java.util.List<FragmentType> template)
        Makes a C2-symmetric catalyst given a template for half the catalyst. Of course, the conformations may not be C2-symmetric, but this method guarantees that the catalyst will have two identical halves.
